intro: Vochysia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower chironia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, often pendulous inflorescences that bear small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forest environments and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Vochysia densiflora plays an important ecological role in supporting local biodiversity through its floral resources.
